The GSA needs to be democratic

Whilst my views do not necessarily represent those of the GSA, I believe it is important to shed light on matters of unscrupulous behaviour.

The University must come clean on "tax haven" dealings

I wouldn't go as far as to accuse the University of hiding the fact that they aren't the whole owners - you can find this information if you snoop around in Companies House for long enough. But they certainly didn't go out of their way to make sure that we all knew.

Pushing the boundaries of presidential prerogative

While Taylor's intentions are praiseworthy, the game of YUSU politics unfortunately means he was wrong to submit the proposal without wider consultation.

Know your candidates

The beginning of spring term is a time of morning frost, bird song and of course seeing the hopeful faces of YUSU candidates taped to every lamppost, tree and kitchen window.

Accommodation: Are we getting what we pay for?

I'm not for one second suggesting that we are the first freshers who've had to deal with the trials and tribulations of campus life, but tuition fees are rising and quality doesn't seem to be improving.

Ratify Palestine Solidarity Society

A spot of bother

'Spotted', whilst containing a number of objectionable comments, its open yet utterly opaque format means anyone could become a target. Far more pervasive than a dispute amongst the twitterarti.

A little shout-out to lecturers

Pass the humble pie - I have missed lectures, and yes, one absence was indeed the result of a Willow Monday night outing. But Guy Halsall is right, missing lectures is just burning money.

I wouldn't go as far as to accuse the University of hiding the fact that they aren't the whole owners - you can find this information if you snoop around in Companies House for long enough. But they certainly didn't go out of their way to make sure that we all knew.

A spot of bother

'Spotted', whilst containing a number of objectionable comments, its open yet utterly opaque format means anyone could become a target. Far more pervasive than a dispute amongst the twitterarti.

A little shout-out to lecturers

Pass the humble pie - I have missed lectures, and yes, one absence was indeed the result of a Willow Monday night outing. But Guy Halsall is right, missing lectures is just burning money.
